div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION
No 3482 RETURN
TO SAID COURT;

Now comes the respondent, Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration at the Port of Seattle, Washington, and for answer and return to the writ of habeas corpus herein says that here produces the body of Kunijiro Toguchi, the person named in the petition for said writ, in obedience to the command and direction thereof and for further return and answer to said writ here avers that he detained in his custody the body of the said Kunijiro Toguchi for deportation from the United States as an alien not entitled to admission under the laws of the United States, under and by virtue of an order of the Secretary of Labor of the United States issued to him, the said respondent, on the sixth day of December, 1916, by telegraph, which said order is in the words and figures following, to-wit:
"54076/74 "December 6, 1916. "Immigration Service, Seattle, Wash. "Dedicant Kunijiro Toguchi. "Hampton."

Respondent shows to the court that the translation of the code word "dedicant" is as follows, "Secretary (or Assistant Secretary or Acting Secretary) has affirmed excluding decision, Board (or your excluding decision)
case of alien named and directs deportation."

Respondent attaches hereto the complete record, decision and exhibts in said matter, both in the hearing before said Commissioner and on appeal to the Secretary of Labor, which constitute a part of this return.
And now the respondent having fully answered and made due return prays that said writ may be discharged and that he may be awarded costs about said return in this behalf expended.
Hampton White Commissioner of Immigration.
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION}} SS.

Henry M. White, being first duly sworn, upon his oath deposes and says: That he is the Commissioner of Immigration named in the foregoing return; that he has read the said return, knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true.
Henry M. White
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 15th day of December, 1916. Edm Laken
Notary Public in and for the Deptuy Clerk U.S. District Court residing at Seattle.
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. Northern DIVISION.
RETURN
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION DEC 16 1916 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Edm Lakin Deputy
